channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-3727] Camel MQTT Consumes Duplicate Messages After Broker Restart
item.description:
After a broker restart, the MQTT consumer begins to receive duplicate messages. Also, on the client side, the following message type begins to continuously pour out at a rapid rate:

2015-07-29 08:55:33,378 [Camel (camel-1) thread #0 - timer://foo] INFO  mqtt-route-sender              - Sending message: Test-message: 2015-07-29 08:55:33

Note that when using Camel version 2.12.0.redhat-610379, this behavior does not occur. During the broker outage, the MQTT producer queues the messages on the client side, and when the broker restarts, all the messages are successfully sent to the broker and consumed by the consumer. The consumer is not given any duplicate messages.
item.summary: Camel MQTT Consumes Duplicate Messages After Broker Restart

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I didn't hit a root cause yet though, filed a JIRA against camel upstream as it's reproducible with current upstream master. There's a workaround for this issue, If you remove "clientId" from mqtt endpoint parameters, then duplicate doesn't happen.
Hi Tomohisa igarashi I just merged it.
Thanks Kevin Earls! so it should be verifiable in next ER.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Use the attached MQTT Camel routes to send and receive messages via an ActiveMQ broker. While the producer and consumer routes are running, stop the broker, wait a bit, then restart the broker.

What follows are the contents of the client side log for test runs that use Camel 2.15.1.redhat-620133 and 2.12.0.redhat-610379, respectively. In the first run, the “INFO MQTTEndpoint” messages begin to pour out when the broker is restarted and the duplicate messages also begin to occur.

~~~~ Test Run With 2.15.1.redhat-620133 ~~~~~

2015-07-29 09:00:25,498 [main] INFO  SpringCamelContext             - AllowUseOriginalMessage is enabled. If access to the original message is not needed, then its recommended to turn this option off as it may improve performance.
 
2015-07-29 09:00:25,498 [main] INFO  SpringCamelContext             - StreamCaching is not in use. If using streams then its recommended to enable stream caching. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/stream-caching.html
 
2015-07-29 09:00:25,538 [main] INFO  MQTTEndpoint                   - Connecting to tcp://10.0.1.4:61612 using 10 seconds timeout
 
2015-07-29 09:00:25,582 [hawtdispatch-DEFAULT-2] WARN  MQTTEndpoint                   - No topic subscriptions were specified in configuration
 
2015-07-29 09:00:25,583 [hawtdispatch-DEFAULT-2] INFO  MQTTEndpoint                   - MQTT Connection connected to tcp://10.0.1.4:61612
 
2015-07-29 09:00:25,652 [main] INFO  SpringCamelContext             - Route: mqtt-route-sender started and consuming from: Endpoint[timer://foo?period=1s&repeatCount=60]
